intro: Tragacantha supina, commonly known as the prostrate tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that produces yellow flowers in the summer months. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in wastelands and along roadsides. The species is valued for its ability to stabilize soil and its historical use in traditional medicine.
